subSubSection.paragraph: Remarks. No additional specimens of this species were found in this study.

Euseius citrifolius
Denmark & Muma

FEMALE. (
3 specimens
measured)

Dorsal shield 325 ( 313–338 ) long and 225 ( 225 – 225 ) wide; j 1 26 ( 24–30 ), j 3 30 ( 29–32 ), j 4 14 ( 13–15 ), j 5 13 ( 12–14 ), j 6 15 ( 14–16 ), J 2 16 ( 15–18 ), J 5 6 ( 6–7 ), z 2 22 ( 21–23 ), z 4 25 ( 25–26 ), z 5 14 ( 13–15 ), Z 1 15 ( 13– 16 ), Z 4 18 ( 17–19 ), Z 5 67 ( 63–73 ), s 4 39 ( 37–41 ), S 2 19 ( 18–20 ), S 4 21 ( 19–22 ), S 5 27 ( 26–30 ), r 3 17 , R 1 13 ; distances between st 1 -st 3 56 ( 54–57 ), st 2 -st 2 66 ( 62–68 ) and st 5 -st 5 70 ( 66–77 ); ventri-anal shield 102 ( 100– 105 ) long, 52 ( 50–53 ) wide at level of ZV 2 and 73 ( 65–78 ) wide at level of anus; JV 5 39 ( 38–41 ); movable cheliceral digit 23 long, with 1 tooth; fixed cheliceral digit 26 ( 25–26 ) long (number of teeth not possible to count); calyx of spermatheca 21 ( 20–21 ) long; Sge
I 21
( 20–23 ), Sge
II 24
( 22–26 ), Sge
III 26
( 26–27 ), Sti
III 24
( 24–25 ), Sge

( 42–45 ), Sti
IV 31
( 28–33 ), St
IV 59
( 57–62 ). Chaetotaxy: genu II 2 , 2/ 0-2 /0, 1; genu III 1 , 2/ 1-2 /0, 1.

Specimens examined. Salta : Metán – Crestón (
25 ° 29 ' 25.3 ''S
,
64 ° 58 ' 28.10 ''W
),
12 -V- 2007
, on
Vassobia breviflora
( 10 Ψ, 1 ɗ). Tucumán : San Miguel de Tucumán – Portal La Virginia (
26 ° 42 ' 41.4 ''S
,
64 ° 57 ' 44.5 ''W
),
15 -V- 2007
, on
Nicotiana glauca
( 2 Ψ).

Remarks. Females collected in this study have one more seta on genu III than reported in the original description, similarly to what was reported by Guanilo et al . ( in press ) for specimens from Peru .

Previous records. Argentina [ Entre Ríos (
Chant 1959
) and Tucumán (
Fernandez et al . 1988
,
Furtado et al . 2007
)], Brazil , Colombia , Costa Rica , El Salvador , Guatemala , Honduras , Montenegro , Nicaragua , Paraguay , Peru (Guanilo et al . in press ), Portugal , Trinidad and Venezuela .

Remarks. Females collected in this study have measurements similar to those reported by McMurtry ( 1983 ) for the holotype . As reported by
Noronha & Moraes ( 2002 )
for Brazilian populations, several of the setae of the specimens collected have highly variable lengths.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Euseius finlandicus ,
De
Leon 1966 : 86 ;
Moraes et al . 1986
: 41
; 2004 : 66 ;
Chant & McMurtry 2005 b
: 215
; 2007 : 121
Euseius pruni
Oudemans 1915
: 183
(synonymy by
Oudemans 1930
;
Westerboer & Bernhard 1963
).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks. No additional specimens of this species were found in this study. The only record of this species in Argentina was presented by
Cunliffe & Baker ( 1953 )
, and it has never been reported from any other countries in South America . Given its considerable similarity with other species in this genus, it seems that the record of those authors for Argentina could represent a misidentification.
